awd_titl_txt: Connection of Schools to Ohio Academic Resources Network    and NSFNET
awd_abstract_narration: Ohio State University requests support from NSF for connection of               Heidelberg University, Antioch University, and Ohio Wesleyan                    University to the Ohio Academic Resources Network (OARnet) which                is the NSF mid-level network that serves the State of Ohio.  A                  primary goal of OARnet is to facilitate collaborative projects                  and sharing of resources between instutuion, including those                    outside the state.                                                                                                                                              OARnet will provide operations management and information                       services and it will give the three universities a connection to                the NSFNET, a high speed (1.5 - 45 million bits per second)                     National Backbone network.                                                                                                                                      The universities need greater functionality and network speed to                be able to access supercomputers, libraries, and make file                      transfers along with being able to implement a more reliable mail               system. Students and faculty research will benefit from the link.               This is also a unique opportunity for the schools to explore                    annovative educational resources.***
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems
